translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for the Doctrinal Expositions

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)🔽12.18. Saraṇaduka, Mahantaraduka🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nasārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya  saraṇaduka mahantaraduka  na saraṇam na sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: The Two-Door Exposition🔽With respect to a non-root condition and a non-object condition … (abbreviated) … with respect to an indeterminate condition, there is one.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nacittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na saraṇam na cittam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With respect to a non-root condition and a non-mental condition … (abbreviated) … with respect to an object condition, there are two … with respect to a result condition, there is one … with respect to an indeterminate condition, there are five.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nacetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… nasaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na cetasikam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi  na saraṇam na citta sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca pe na saraṇam na citta sasaṭṭham dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With respect to a non-root condition and a non-concomitant condition … (abbreviated) … with respect to an object condition, there is one … with respect to an indeterminate condition, there are three.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… nasaraṇaṁ nacittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… nasaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… nasaraṇaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽…. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na saraṇam na citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca pe na saraṇam na citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi  na saraṇam na citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca pe na saraṇam na citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhu  dhammam paṭicca pe na saraṇam na citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca  saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi

original: Nasaraṇaṁ naupādā dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ naupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na saraṇam na aupādāḥ dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri  na saraṇam na aupādinnam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With an object that is not clung to as condition … (Abbreviated.) With a condition being a root, there are four possibilities. With a condition being an object, there are two possibilities. … With a condition being kamma, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a nutriment, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a faculty, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a dependence, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a prenascence, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a decisive-support, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a non-adverting, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a proximity, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a contiguity, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a dissociation, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a presence, there are four possibilities. With a condition being an absence, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a disappearance, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a disappearance-of-disappearance, there are four possibilities. With a condition being a result, there is one possibility. … With a condition being an outlet, there are four possibilities. …🔽With an object that is not clung to and that is not a condition being a root, there are five possibilities. With an object that is not clung to and that is not a condition being an object, there are two possibilities. … With an object that is not clung to and that is not a condition being a result, there is one possibility. … With an object that is not clung to and that is not a condition being an outlet, there are five possibilities.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ naanupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na saraṇam na anupādinnam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
